intro: Orthophytum cearense, commonly known as the Ceará spinefoot, is a species of cactus native to Brazil. It is characterized by its spiny, cylindrical stems that are typically green to reddish in color. The plant produces small, yellow flowers during the warmer months, which attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, demonstrating high drought tolerance. Its unique morphology and ecological adaptations make it an important component of its native habitat.
